name: Vine Troll Skeleton
description: A large undead creature with exceptional physical strength, resembling a skeletal troll, bound to a duskthorn dryad or tree.
memorable: The Vine Troll Skeleton can regenerate hit points unless damaged by acid or fire, making it a resilient adversary.
goals: To serve as a guardian tied to its binding tree or dryad.
relations: Magically bound to a duskthorn dryad, tree, or treant.
environment: Typically found in forests or areas with dense vegetation.
strengths: High hit points and regeneration ability, resistance to nonmagical damage.
weaknesses: Vulnerable to acid and fire damage; can be destroyed if its binding tree is killed.
attacks: Uses a multiattack option involving a powerful bite and claw attacks, as well as ranged poisoned thorn attacks.
most_powerful_ability: Regeneration trait that allows it to regain hit points unless it takes acid or fire damage.
additional_information: Immune to poison damage and conditions like exhaustion.
Low intelligence and charm, making it a mindless predator.
Durability enhanced by magical binding to its tree.
Can only die if its binding entity is killed or it starts its turn with 0 hit points.
Versatile in combat with both melee and ranged attacks.
test_queries: skeleton with regeneration and poison attacks
large undead tied to a tree
vulnerable to fire and acid damage
creature that serves a duskthorn dryad
